“Hidden Gem at gate el Gharbi”\n“Great rooftop terrace great lunch”

\na working atm inside and a nice wee cafe next door who do amazing banana splits\n... you can feel comfortable there.There are a lot of beautiful things, souvenirs, dresses, shoes on high quality etc...of course I bought some gifts, shoes,dresses and spices and payed by card with no problem
This beautiful and historic town on Tunisia’s east coast is well preserved in parts, carefully restored in others. The old quarter is dominated by the rebuilt Central Mosque.
This medina contains the Great Mosque of Sousse.

\n... best from above when looking down from the Ribat and good when you are close down at the Marina There are a number of restaurants around this area where one can sit and look at the boats and watch the world go by\n... with restaurants selling sea food and you can just look over the sea while you enjoy a good cup of coffee or tea with mint local favourite the fresh squeezed orange is to die for have a glass you will be back ...
\nWent to the Ribat well worth the 7 Dina each we paid Fantastic views from the top even very windy great culture of Tunisia\nWell worth a visit!

\nGreat mosaics, friendly staff that went out of their way for a special needs child, handicapped accessible, clean, well presented, our favourite piece was the baptismal font.\nThis museum is very interesting and has a very nice display of roman mosaics well preserved and of potteries and old oil lamps from the christic time.
